title: Support Tickets can be created on behalf of other users using spoofed email | Bypass of #2001913

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
Hi team,
Hope you are doing well.I came across a disclosed report by hackerone (#2001913) wherein a researcher was able to create a support ticket on behalf of other users by sending fake email to support@hackerone.com. The issue was fixed by hackerone and sending email to support@hackerone.com does not create support tickets anymore.But,there is a bypass to this fix.
**Description:**
Hackerone uses freshdesk as their third party service provider to handle support tickets .In freshdesk if a email is sent to support@domain.freshdesk.com it would create support tickets on behalf of the user.Similarly,if an email is sent to support@hackerone.freshdesk.com using a fake mailer like https://emkei.cz then a support ticket is  created by an attacker for the victim.

### Steps To Reproduce
1. Visit https://emkei.cz or any other fake mailer website.
2. Put the victim email in from field and support@hackerone.freshdesk.com in the to field.
3. Fill in the body with any message like account deletion and support ticket would be created in the behalf of victim and the support team will take it as legitimate request and process the request .

### Mitigation:
1.Freshdesk has a fix to the issue such that only emails sent to particular email address will only create tickets.The feature is called **Prevent Wildcard Ticket Create**.More deatils at https://support.freshdesk.com/en/support/solutions/articles/50000000652-receiving-spam-emails-to-support-domain-freshdesk-com-please-help-


### Optional: Supporting Material/References (Screenshots)

 * Screenshot attached.██████
* Check ticket **471406** created by me on a test account of mine.

## Impact

1.It is possible to perform sensitive action on behalf of victim .
2.Ability to spam the support inbox thus increasing the wait time and leading to inconvenience for legitimate users.

activities.message:
Hi @as_patro ,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_amey

additional_data.new_title: Support Tickets can be created on behalf of other users using spoofed email | Bypass of #2001913

activities.message:
Hello @as_patro,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_amey

Hi @h1_analyst_amey ,
Thanks for the update.
Looking forward for update from the internal team.
Regards,
@as_patro

Hey @as_patro,

Sorry for the inconsistency on this, but (and I am quoting here from https://hackerone.com/security/policy_scopes)

> `support.hackerone.com` is out of scope. This asset is hosted by Freshdesk (as of 2023-04-28), and as such these reports should be submitted to the appropriate program: https://hackerone.com/freshworks

{F2609011}

As a result, we're closing this as N/A. Thanks!

Hi @eggscute ,
I agree that this is out of scope but it affects the users of main domain.
Also hackerone has awarded bounty thrice for this issue and it is an bypass to this report.
The report I'd are as follows:
#2068830
#2082680
#2001913
Its completely unfair that hackerone awarded thrice for the issue and in my case closed the report as NA.Why were the other three reports accepted when it is out of scope?
The flaw affects hackerone users itself and it is a problem in hackerone's implementation and not freshdesk so I reported it here.
Awaiting your response,
@as_patro

Hi @zerotea,
Please look into this matter and provide a  response.
Awaiting your reply,
@as_patro

Hi @h1_analyst_amey ,
Can you please have a word with @zerotea on this report because he had triaged the other three reports for the similar issue.
Regards,
@as_patro

Apologies for the closure of this, though the asset itself is out of scope. However, email spoofing remains relevant.

I'm discussing this submission internally with the team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

Hi @eggscute ,
Thanks for the reply and reopening the report.Let me know if there is any additional details to share.
Regards,
Asish

Hi @eggscute ,
Any update?
Regards,
Asish

Hi @eggscute ,
Any update from the team?
Regards,
Asish

Hi @eggscute and @h1_analyst_amey ,
It has been 4 days since the last update.Please provide an update.
Regards,
Asish

Hi @as_patro,

I am moving this report to Pending Program Review while the Security Team discussed this report internally.

I will get back to you as soon as I hear back from them. Please bear with us in the meantime.

Thank you for your patience.

Cheers,
@h1_analyst_amey

Hi @h1_analyst_amey,
Thanks for the reply.
Regards,
Asish

Hi @as_patro,

Apologies for the back and forth and the wait. I'm still talking to the internal team. I'll update you soon.

Hi @eggscute ,
Thanks for the reply.
Looking forward to hear from you soon.
Regards,
Asish

Hi @eggscute and @h1_analyst_amey ,
Do you have any update from the internal team?
Regards,
Asish
Hi @as_patro, we are still investigating.

Hi @zerotea ,
Thanks for providing the update.It has been around 2 weeks so I asked for an update.
Looking forward to hear from you soon.
Regards,
Asish
We are discussing with an internal party and the communication loop for that is relatively complicated, so it might take some time to get a proper response, rest assured we are working on it :)

Hi @zerotea ,
Thanks for the update.I really appreciate your responsiveness.
Thanks
Asish
Hey, jumping in really quick to request a retest as I got word this has now been fixed. My colleague will pick this up later and determine severity & award bounty.

I tried creating a ticket with the above method but received an email stating:
This email no longer accepts new requests.
Also,the ticket is immediately closed.
Regards,
Asish

Hi @zerotea ,
Thanks for the update.Have a great day ahead.
Regards,
**Asish**

Hi @zerotea ,
Why there is no further update on this report?
Regards,
**Asish**

Hey @as_patro, sorry this took a while longer to resolve.

So what ended up happening is that this report had a fix applied, and as a result, the hacker that reported #2079502 told us we resolved their issue without communicating back to them. This prompted an investigation and we're evaluating if this report is a duplicate of #2079502. It's currently looking like a yes.

That's - bluntly put - very unfortunate as we handled this report first and used your time where another hacker will get credited for reporting it first. I am investigating what I can do about this, at the moment let me approve the retest.

Hi @zerotea ,
I am experiencing some issue in adding a comment to that report.Can you please check and say if a comment has been made from my side on that report?
Regards,
@as_patro
@as_patro Looks like it didn't work: feel free to post it here, I am monitoring both reports.

I re-added you to the report, hope it's fixed now.

{F2676507}{F2676506}

Hi @zerotea ,
I really appreciate the transparency on this report.I understand that a lot of reports were submitted and this caused a lot of confusion .I disagree with the decision that my report is a duplicate of #2079502 .
The fix applied in case of #2001913 did not work in case of #2079502 as the root cause was that the emails were redirected to support@hackerone.freshdesk.com internally which was the issue reported by me.Also, #2079502 demonstrated creating tickets by sending emails to email address like hackers@hackerone.com , hello@hackerone.com ,info@hackerone.com ,vpn-support@hackerone.com ,dmca@hackerone.com etc. which internally redirected to support@hackerone.freshdesk.com
When the issue regarding creating tickets by sending an email to the support@hackerone.freshdesk.com was fixed which is the root cause of all these reports,the report #2079502 was automatically fixed .Even if  #2079502 would have been looked first before my report then I think my issue would not have been fixed.
So,when the root cause has been reported by me why it is a duplicate of #2079502 .Could me please provide an explanation on how the issue was fixed?
Awaiting your reply,
@as_patro

Hi @zerotea ,
This is my reply .I am able to access #2079502 now.
Thanks,
**Asish**

Hey, I'm giving both hackers the benefit of the doubt here, the truth is it would likely cost us more than $1000 to properly investigate this issue, especially since I was already thinking of giving you a bonus otherwise.

I hope this rounds off the whole Support impersonation chain of reports we've been receiving!
Same strategy as all other reports in this chain: https://hackerone.com/reports/2001913
Doesn't look like there's anything sensitive in my report, if you agree let's disclose :)

Hi @zerotea ,
Thanks for the bounty and the transparency throughout this report.
Regards,
@as_patro
@zerotea Could you please redact my email address?
I found an email in your initial image I redacted, assuming it was a real one.
I think there was only one occurance (in an image), is that correct?
Yes @zerotea that's the only thing to be redacted.
